column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make a Carrot Clarinet
#Text=Clarinets are a musical instrument from the woodwind family .
#Text=The clarinet is classified by its cylindrical shape and the type of mouthpiece used to play it .
#Text=Traditional clarinets are made from plastic or wood in a factory , but you can make one at home for fun , using just a carrot !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Buy a large carrot .
#Text=It should be quite large ( 190mm or longer ) .
#Text=This carrot should be sturdy and not soft .
#Text=Gather other supplies .
#Text=Get a clarinet or saxophone mouthpiece , reed , and ligature .
#Text=Get a kitchen knife , vegetable peeler , and funnel .
#Text=Get a tube that is 12mm in diameter cut to 35mm long and some electrical tape .
#Text=Get an electric drill with a 12mm spade bit and a 7mm drill bit .
#Text=Cut the ends of the carrot off .
#Text=The length of the carrot should come to about 187mm .
#Text=Mark 6 holes on the front of the carrot .
#Text=The 1st hole should be 39mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=The 2nd hole should be 54mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=The 3rd hole should be 74mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=The 4th hole should be 97mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=The 5th hole should be 123mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=The 6th hole should be 140mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=Mark one hole on the back for your thumb .
#Text=The thumbhole should be 22mm from the top of the carrot .
#Text=Drill through the center of the carrot .
#Text=Use the 12mm spade bit and drill straight down the center of the carrot from top to bottom .
#Text=As you drill , dump the contents of the inside of the carrot into the bowl .
#Text=Drill until there is a clear path from one end of the carrot to the next .
#Text=Drill the 6 holes on the front of the carrot .
#Text=Use the 7mm drill bit to drill each of the marked 6 holes through to the center of the carrot .
#Text=Drill the 1 hole on the back of the carrot .
#Text=Use the 7mm drill bit to drill the 1 marked hole through to the center of the carrot .
#Text=Use a vegetable peeler to peel off a layer over the holes on the carrot .
#Text=This created a slightly flat part of the carrot that will home the finger and thumb holes for the clarinet .
#Text=Attach a 12mm tube to the bottom of the mouthpiece .
#Text=If the tube does not stay in the mouthpiece , wrap a piece of electrical tape around the end of the tube to widen the wall of the tube .
#Text=( Some mouthpieces will fit differently from others . )
#Text=Attach the 12mm tube and mouthpiece to the top of the carrot .
#Text=The opposite end of the tube should fit inside of the top of the carrot .
#Text=Add a funnel to the bottom of the carrot , if desired .
#Text=The funnel makes the carrot look more like a clarinet and amplify the sound a little bit .
#Text=The carrot is playable without the funnel .
